article.name: Defend - Configuring Linguistic Analysis
article.title: Defend - Configuring Linguistic Analysis
article.body:
The Linguistic Analysis setting in Defend leverages Natural Language Processing (NLP) to analyze the emotion and intent behind every email, helping to detect unusual or suspicious behavior. This is an advanced feature that enhances email security by identifying potential threats that might not be caught by traditional methods.

To maintain accuracy and avoid false positives, it's important to inform Defend about custom phrases that your organization may add to email subject lines. Common examples of these subject line additions include:

  • [EXTERNAL]
  • [CONFIDENTIAL]
  • [SECURE]
  • [INTERNAL ONLY]

To configure the list of custom subject line phrases, follow the steps below:

  1. Log in to the Defend console.
  2. Navigate to the Settings page.
  3. Locate the Linguistic Anlaysis section.
  4. Enter your custom subject line phrases in the Custom Subject Phrases text box.
  5. Select Save Changes.
Note: It is recommended that this setting is regularly reviewed to ensure it is accurate and up-to-date.

images.alt:
This technical description details a configuration dialog, presented in a dark-mode theme, for managing subject line phrase exclusions.

**Context and Header:**
The dialog is titled **"Custom Subject Phrases."** An accompanying description clarifies the functionality: "Phrases that are added to the subject by mail rules or another product will be stripped before linguistically analyzing the subject."

**Phrase List/Input Area:**
The primary content area displays a current entry, formatted as a horizontal input field.
1.  **Input Field:** Contains the placeholder text **"Phrase,"** indicating where the custom phrase is entered.
2.  **Deletion Control:** To the right of the input field is an inline **trashcan icon**, used for removing the associated phrase entry from the list.

**Action Buttons (Controls):**
Three controls are present at the bottom of the interface:
1.  **Add Item:** A prominent blue button on the left, used to append a new, empty input field to the list.
2.  **Save:** A muted/secondary button on the right, used to commit and apply the current configuration changes.
3.  **Cancel:** A muted/secondary button adjacent to "Save," used to discard changes and close the dialog.
